alert.note: Alert for Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 10 at 2:28PM AKST until December 11 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches. Blowing snow will reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts may form. Power outages may occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow and worst conditions are expected near Nome through early Saturday evening.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
